name: vacuum cleaner production | vacuum cleaner | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20593/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average vacuum cleaner which is approximately 4.45 kg in mass and has a rating of 1400 W. This vacuum cleaner has the envisaged lifetime of 8 years and is manufactured in China. The figures on material inputs from technosphere and energy required to produce an average vaccum cleaner are taken from Gallego-Schmid et al. 2016. The figure on the annual production volume (130000000 units) is calculated from Markets Insider 2017.

This activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory.

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing an average vacuum cleaner. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/275:Manufacture of domestic appliances/2750:Manufacture of domestic appliances

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The literature sources used refer to the underpinning technology as being current.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average vacuum cleaner. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in China.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in China.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Annual production volume of vacuum cleaners is assumed to equate to the annual number of global shipments / unit sales as derived for 2018 based on the 2024 forecast from Markets Insider 2017.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Gallego-Schmid et al. 2016. Data on the annual production volume are assumed to be equal to the annual volume of unit sales and taken from Markets Insider 2017. Sources: Gallego-Schmid, A., Mendoza, J.M.F., Jeswani, H.K., and Azapagic, A., 2016. Life cycle environmental impacts of vacuum cleaners and the effects of European legislation. Science of the Total Environment, 559, 192-203. Markets Insider 2017. Household vacuum cleaner market - 130 million unit shipments by 2014. Available from: http://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/Household-Vacuum-Cleaner-Market-130-million-unit-shipments-by-2024-1011243349 (Accessed 07 January 2018).

exchanges.description: Used here in place of infrastructure based on the amount of the largest contributor to the final product mass (plastics). This is an estimated value. According to the technology comment of the dataset 'Plastic processing factory construction, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018], the life time of the tanks is assumed to be 50 years and the annual production is 27000 t/a. Thus, the estimated lifetime output of the factory is 27000 x 50 = 1350000. As the vacuum cleaner mass is 4.45 kg, then the number of vacuum cleaners produced during the lifetime of the factory is 1350000 / 0.00445 = 303370787 units. The calculation of the infrastructure is therefore 1/life time capacity = 1/303370787 unit.
